thread.title: Marion PD Now Led by 2 Women, Chief Says Gender Not Important
thread.title_full: Marion PD Now Led by 2 Women, Chief Says Gender Not Important

title: Marion PD Now Led by 2 Women, Chief Says Gender Not Important
text:
Marion PD Now Led by 2 Women, Chief Says Gender Not Important   12, 2015 at 10:11   12, 2015 at 11:03 PM CDT 
MARION -- Commissioners voted late Monday night to promote Tina Morrow to assistant police chief, meaning the department is now led by two women. 
"Well, I like to not think of it as just two women," said Chief Dawn Tondini afterward. "I think it's two capable leaders. Hopefully that's what people will think." 
Morrow began serving the city of Marion 19 years ago, first as a dispatcher and two years later as a police officer. She'll officially become assistant chief on Saturday. 
The opening was created because the current assistant chief, Dan Byrne, is retiring. At a celebration at City Hall Monday, Byrne told Mayor Bob Butler that he was only two-months-old when Butler first began leading the city. Now, that young constituent has reached retirement age. 
Chief Tondini called Morrow her "primary choice" to fill Byrne's position. 
"She's good with people, very articulate," said Tondini. 
Commissioners spent much of the night in executive session, in part because they wanted to discuss Morrow's salary in private. They then went back into open session, announcing Morrow would receive a base salary of $62,000 per year and voting to approve her promotion.
